title: Masala Dosa
ingredients: For dosa batter: 2 cups rice, 1 cup urad dal, salt
For potato masala: 3 potatoes, 1 onion, 2 green chilies, curry leaves, mustard seeds, turmeric, salt
instructions: Soak rice and urad dal separately for 6 hours.
Grind separately, mix together, add salt, and ferment overnight.
Boil potatoes, peel and mash them.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies.
Add onions, saut√© until golden, add turmeric and salt.
Add mashed potatoes and mix well.
Make thin dosas, add potato masala, fold, and serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Dosa Masters

title: Sambar Recipe
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (drumstick, carrot, beans, brinjal)
For tempering: 2 tbsp oil, 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp fenugreek seeds, 2 dried red chilies, curry leaves, asafoetida
instructions: Cook toor dal until soft and mash it well.
Cook mixed vegetables until tender in a separate pot.
Add tamarind pulp, sambar powder, turmeric, and salt to vegetables.
Add mashed dal and mix well. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Heat oil for tempering, add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and red chilies.
Add curry leaves and asafoetida. Pour tempering over sambar.
Serve hot with rice, idli, or dosa.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Traditional South Indian Kitchen

title: Idli Recipe
instructions: Soak rice and urad dal separately for 6 hours.
Grind urad dal with fenugreek seeds to smooth paste.
Grind rice to coarse paste.
Mix both batters, add salt, and mix well.
Let batter ferment overnight (8-12 hours) in warm place.
Grease idli plates, pour batter, and steam for 10-12 minutes.
Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Breakfast Masters

title: Coconut Chutney
ingredients: For tempering: 1 tsp oil, mustard seeds, curry leaves, dried red chili
instructions: Grind coconut, roasted chana dal, green chilies, ginger, and cumin seeds.
Add salt and water to make smooth paste.
Heat oil for tempering, add mustard seeds.
Add curry leaves and dried red chili.
Pour tempering over chutney and mix well.
Serve with dosas, idlis, or rice.
Store in refrigerator for up to 2 days.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Chutney Masters

title: Rasam Recipe
ingredients: For tempering: 2 tsp oil, 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 2 dried red chilies, curry leaves, coriander leaves
instructions: Cook toor dal until soft and mash it well.
In a pot, add chopped tomatoes, tamarind pulp, and water.
Add rasam powder, turmeric, and salt. Boil until tomatoes are soft.
Add mashed dal and mix well. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Heat oil for tempering, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and red chilies.
Add curry leaves and pour tempering over rasam.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Hotel Masters

title: Bisi Bele Bath
instructions: Cook rice and toor dal together until soft.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Add cashews and peanuts, roast until golden.
Add vegetables and cook until tender.
Add bisi bele bath powder and tamarind pulp.
Add cooked rice-dal mixture and mix well.
Cook for 10-15 minutes on low heat. Serve hot.

title: Medu Vada
instructions: Soak urad dal overnight and drain water completely.
Grind dal to smooth paste without adding water.
Add cumin seeds, black pepper, green chilies, and ginger.
Add curry leaves, coriander leaves, and salt. Mix well.
Heat oil for deep frying.
Wet hands, take small portions, make hole in center, and drop in hot oil.
Fry until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Snack Specialists

title: Rava Dosa
instructions: Mix semolina, rice flour, and all-purpose flour in a bowl.
Add yogurt and mix well, then add water to make thin batter.
Add cumin seeds, black pepper, green chilies, and ginger.
Add curry leaves, coriander leaves, and salt. Mix well.
Let batter rest for 15-20 minutes.
Heat tawa, pour batter in circular motion to make thin dosas.
Cook until crispy and golden brown on both sides.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Breakfast Specialists

title: Tomato Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
Add curry leaves, green chilies, and sliced onions.
Saut√© until onions turn golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt.
Cook until tomatoes turn mushy and oil separates.
Add cooked rice and mix gently until well combined.
Cook for 2-3 minutes on low heat. Serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: South Indian Rice Specialists

title: Coconut Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add urad dal, chana dal, and dried red chilies.
Saut√© until dals turn golden brown.
Add curry leaves and grated coconut. Saut√© for 2 minutes.
Add salt and mix well.
Add cooked rice and mix gently until well combined.
Cook for 2-3 minutes on low heat. Serve hot.
